posts.title: Vue and You
posts.body:
New Firebase Version 9 Content
Hey gang,

I just wanted to let you know that I've now added a new chapter near the end of the course all about using Vue 3 with Firebase 9. Version 9 of Firebase adopts a more modular & functional approach, which takes advantage of something called "tree-shaking". This means that any unused Firebase code is "shaken" out of our final production bundles, leading to a better performance.

In version 9, much of the functionality of Firebase, under the hood, is the same as previous versions. So it would definitely benefit you to go through the previous course projects first (that use Firebase 8) to solidify your understanding of Firebase concepts.

posts.title: Vue Development Differently!
posts.body:
New Firebase Version (version 9)
Hi all,

Just a quick update regarding Firebase. The projects in this course currently use Firebase version 8 (which is completely fine to use, I still use this version in some of my live projects). So for these course projects I would suggest that when you install the Firebase package, install version 8 so that you can follow along as I do without any problems. You can specify the version you install by saying npm install firebase@8.5 (the @8.5 bit means install version 8.5, and will be fully compatible with the course projects).

However, Firebase 9 has now been released, which adopts a more modular & functional approach, (so the way we work with it is slightly different). Therefore, I will be making a new chapter about how to use Vue 3 with Firebase version 9 over the next 2-3 weeks.
